data.title: Virginia Tech Hokie Women’s Basketball Gets a Big 2025 Commitment at Point Guard in Kate Sears
data.meta_description: Well, no one can say that Megan Duffy didn’t hit the road in a full sprint.  She filled her assistant staff in record time and started pulling in recruits almost immediately.  Kate Sears is a super, very local get and looks to push the Hokies new look to great heights.  GO HOKIES!!!
data.text:
Well, the Hokies Haven’t Stumbled on the Recruiting Road

Megan Duffy seems like a breeze of fresh air across the New River Valley public relations persona for Virginia Tech Basketball. She’s definitely made some changes in the public offseason image of the team, having some fun with photo sessions for the staff, and hiring first rate assistants who have followed right along with her on the image re-establishment.

Coach Duffy even participated in the tradition of grilled cheese sammis for exam week.

But Image and PR presence aren’t the only things that rebuild programs after major changes. It’s critical that the new coaching staff get wins in the recruiting department and Duffy seems to be stepping right in and filling that diverted stream quickly.

Duffy and staff have some big gets for the future. With Lani White, Kathleen Doyle, Kayl Petersen, Leila Wells, and retaining recruit Myah Hazelton.

Duffy’s big wins on the road were also met with three critical big keeps as Rose Micheaux, Karleigh Wenzel, Matilda Ekh, and Carys Baker have chosen to stay with us in Blacksburg. Those four will form a critical core and institutional memory for the new staff and players.

Duffy isn’t Finished, Though

The big news this weekend was a commitment from Watauga High School Boone, North Carolina junior, Kate Sears. This is a long-term commitment, so we’ll see how her senior year progresses, but it lays a foundation for the 2026 season, and potentially on to 2030.

A big welcome to Hokie Nation for next season to Kate. The future is looking really bright for the new image Hokie Women’s Basketball Team.

It’s going to be fun covering this bunch for the foreseeable future.
